intro: Cryptocarya howii, commonly known as the New Zealand kōwhai, is a small evergreen tree or shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by edible, yellow berries. Cryptocarya howii is often found in coastal and lowland forests, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
